awd_titl_txt: Developing Faculty Resources of Evidence-based Practices that Improve Learning and Equity in STEM
awd_abstract_narration:
With support from the Improving Undergraduate STEM Education: Hispanic-Serving Institutions (HSI) Program, this Track 1 project aims to support faculty at HSIs developing and using evidence-based instructional strategies and materials that improve learning and equity in STEM courses. The project addresses need of developing STEM education research methods and instruments that focuses on diverse students at HSIs. First, the project seeks to support HSI faculty in implementing, adapting and assessing evidence-based instructional strategies that support equitable outcomes. Second, the project will research potential bias in research-based assessments. Third, the project will use the Learning About STEM Student Outcomes (LASSO) online assessment platform to establish baselines for equity in STEM disciplines. By achieving these three goals, the project aims to build the framework and the set of resources on the scholarship of teaching and learning in a culturally diverse and equitable learning environment. 

To address gaps in the literature on evidence-based research to improve learning and equity in STEM courses for students of diverse backgrounds, the project will develop and assess three strands of activities. Strand 1 will identify the motivations for and barriers to faculty at HSIs in engaging in the scholarship of teaching and learning (SOTL). Based on this knowledge, the project will build resources, tools, and workshops that meet the needs of faculty who are working with students from marginalized groups. Central to this support is the LASSO platform, a free online platform for instructors to administer research-based assessments to their students. LASSO provides data collection and analysis support to simplify conducting SOTL in college STEM courses. Strands 2 and 3 will support educators engaging in SOTL by researching potential bias in the research-based assessments themselves and methods commonly used to administer them. This research will ensure the accuracy of the data available to these scholars. To support scholarship on equitable outcomes, the project will use the aggregated LASSO database to both establish baselines for equity in STEM disciplines and identify pedagogies that support equitable outcomes. Equity baselines will provide scholars a comparison for their own studies and courses. The pedagogies that support equity will provide rich areas for them to explore. The outcome of the work will be a framework and set of resources to support scholars at HSIs engaging in SOTL to identify evidence-based practices that improve equity, while addressing issues in the existing literature on equity. The products of the project will be disseminated through various channels including conferences, workshops, publications, and the NSF-funded Learning Assistant Alliance. The HSI Program aims to enhance undergraduate STEM education and build capacity at HSIs. Projects supported by the HSI Program will also generate new knowledge on how to achieve these aims.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

por.por_cntn:
Project Overview This NSF-funded project aimed to improve equity and learning outcomes in STEM education, particularly for underrepresented and marginalized students. It focused on three key strands:

  1. Supporting faculty at Hispanic-Serving Institutions (HSIs) in implementing evidence-based instructional strategies.

  2. Identifying and addressing bias in research-based assessments (RBAs) and practices.

  3. Using the LASSO platform to establish baselines for equity and identify effective pedagogical practices.

Key Accomplishments

  1. Faculty Support at HSIs

    • Conducted interviews with STEM faculty at HSIs, analyzing motivations and barriers to engaging in Scholarship of Teaching and Learning.

    • Designed and ran workshops for faculty, providing tools and frameworks to adopt equity-focused teaching methods.

    • Published multiple articles on culturally relevant pedagogy and faculty decision-making in diverse contexts.

  2. Addressing Bias in Assessments

    • Expanded the LASSO platform, adding over 60 RBAs spanning physics, biology, chemistry, engineering, math, and computer science.

    • Conducted research on differential item function and measurement invariance on the Force Concept Inventory. These studies also addressed common shortcomings in evaluations of bias on assessments.  

  3. Equity Baselines and Pedagogical Practices

    • Used the LASSO database to identify inequity trends across STEM courses, focussing on the educational debts owed to marginalized students.

    • Highlighted practices that enhance equity, including collaborative learning and learning assistant programs, which reduced failure rates and inequities.

    • Developed open-access resources on STEMEquity.net, hosting guides, tools, and materials for equity-focused research and instruction.

Intellectual Merit This project advanced STEM education research by supporting STEM instructors at HSI in engaging in scholarship of teaching and learning, identifying barriers to STEM instructors engaging in culturally relevant teaching, recontextualizing modern quantitative research methods to equity-focussed STEM education research, investigating and promoting the use of emerging intersectional-based quantitative methods, and investigating potential bias in commonly used STEM research-based assessments. 

Broader Impacts The project's workshops, resources, and findings directly supported STEM faculty in transforming their courses to serve diverse student populations better. The expanded LASSO platform is a critical infrastructure for equity research, with data from over 75,000 students in 2,000 courses. Findings have influenced instructional practices and raised awareness of systemic inequities in STEM education, helping to diversify the STEM workforce and improve educational outcomes for underrepresented groups.
